title: DGCA begins inspection of SpiceJet fleet, airline says plane radar indicated 'mild turbulence' - Times of India
content:
1. DGCA begins inspection of SpiceJet fleet, airline says plane radar indicated 'mild turbulence'  Times of India
  2. Probe heat on SpiceJet after mid-air turbulence; Crew & maintenance staff off rostered  Hindustan Times
  3. Experts Call for Better Weather Intelligence After Massive Turbulence in SpiceJet's Flight Led to 11 Hospitalisations | The Weather Channel - Articles from The Weather Channel | weather.com  The Weather Channel
  4. Air turbulence hits SpiceJet: What happened in the air  Times of India
  5. DNA: Plane trapped in turbulence at thousands of feet, video surfaces  Zee News
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: Twelve passengers had to taken to hospital when the SpiceJet flight SG 945 from Mumbai to Durgapur experienced severe turbulence. The plane encountered severe turbulence while approaching the Durgapur airport. Doctors treating the patients too say that most of the injuries were due to falling objects. SpiceJet, while maintaining that all medical help was provided to injured passengers, also said that the seat belt sign was on and multiple announcements were made by the crew in this regard. The airline also said that the aircraft weather radar had indicated “mild turbulence”.Indian aviation regulator DGCA, however, has taken a serious view of the whole episode. Pending investigations, it has derostered the entire crew of the flight, the maintenance engineer who allowed the plane to take off from Durgapur as well as the person in charge of Maintenance Control Center of SpiceJet.
